name: Superposition: A Dive into the Quantum World
description:
Can exploring quantum physics through art change the way we experience reality? Come join Robert Lisek and Dayita Nereyeth as they delve into this evolving landscape.

This visionary performance will explore the intersections of quantum physics, artificial intelligence, human cognition, and artistic expression, merging these fields into a unique experience that is both philosophical inquiry and experiential art.
Set in a dynamic space, laser lights, video projections and dance respond to quantum principles like superposition, entanglement, interference, and decoherence.

This immersive installation encourages participants to experience multiple states of being and perceive layers of reality beyond ordinary perception.

This programmes is part of Studio Quantum, supported by Quantum Delta and V2.

name: The Good, The Bad & The Ugly: Mental Illness in Indian Cinema
description: How does Indian cinema shape our understanding of mental health? From intense portrayals of characters grappling with depression and anxiety to the evolution of therapy on screen, films have a unique power to influence societal beliefs. But are these portrayals helping us break down stigma, or are they reinforcing harmful stereotypes? Join Anushka Banerjee, Chethan B and Kadambari Patil as they examine the impact of cinematic portrayals of public perception and stigma surrounding mental health issues.

name: The Good, The Bad & The Ugly: Mental Illness in Indian Cinema
description: How does Indian cinema shape our understanding of mental health? From intense portrayals of characters grappling with depression and anxiety to the evolution of therapy on screen, films have a unique power to influence societal beliefs. But are these portrayals helping us break down stigma, or are they reinforcing harmful stereotypes? Join Anushka Banerjee, Chethan B and Kadambari Patil as they examine the impact of cinematic portrayals of public perception and stigma surrounding mental health issues.

name: Mental Health: From Genes to Electrical and Magnetic Stimulation
description:
Join Suhas Ganesh and Rakshathi Basavaraju from the National Institute of Mental Health and Neurosciences (NIMHANS) in two short talks followed by an Ask Me Anything (AMA) on mental health.

1) When something is wrong with the body, the mind recognises the change and motivates us to action. When things start going wrong with the mind itself, what happens? In this public lecture, Suhas Ganesh will explore the myriad maladies of the mind and how our mind detects or fails to detect, a change within itself. He also looks at mental health through the lens of genetics. He explores the interplay between genes, experiences and the environment and their effect on the mind.

2) Mental health conditions can be of a multitude of types. The way each individual experiences mental health conditions is also diverse. It is no surprise then that there exist a plethora of treatments in psychiatry. One such treatment is the electric and magnetic stimulation of the brain. In this lecture, Rakshathi Basavaraju offers a glimpse into the types of electromagnetic stimulation in psychiatry, the conditions they treat and their safety.

name: Electricity in Brain Cells
description:
How does electricity in the brain work? How can lab research lead to real-world treatments?
Join Manasadeepika from NIMHANS in a Masterclass as we explore the fascinating science behind brain health, diving into topics like, how action potentials are generated, the role of ion channels, and how our cells produce the energy that keeps us going. She connects the dots between complex science and real-life impact, showing how research translates into solutions that can change lives.

name: Power Shifts in Bengaluru: Sci560 Exhibition walkthrough
description: Mediators Aditi and Pravallika take you on an exhibition walkthrough exploring how power struggles have shaped science, technology, and culture in Bengaluru. The walkthrough focuses on the colonial era, post-independence progress, and contemporary issues. Through key objects and stories, the walkthrough highlights themes of gender inequality in science, the digital divide & the labor question. Join us as we explore the stories about power struggle, oppression and empowerment in Bengaluru.
